SEARCH

Uses of Package
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.commands

Packages that use nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.commands
Package
Description
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.api
This package contains various APIs used throughout the project, including definitions for animated blocks, colors, debugging, factories, highlighted block spawners, the platform interface, and more.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.commands
This package contains command definitions and command factories used by this project, as well as various base command classes and interfaces.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.managers
This package contains managers that manage different certain aspects of the plugin.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.tooluser
Contains the classes for the tool users system.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.tooluser.creator
The creator package contains classes that are responsible for creating structures.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.util.structureretriever
This package contains classes and interfaces related to retrieving structures from the database.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.spigot.core
The AnimatedArchitecture Spigot core module contains classes and interfaces specific to the Spigot platform.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.spigot.core.comands
This package contains classes responsible for handling commands.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.spigot.core.managers
Contains classes that manage various aspects of the plugin specifically for the Spigot platform, such as redstone management and vault economy integration.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.spigot.util
Provides utility classes that depend on the Spigot API and can be used by all modules for the Spigot platform.
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.spigot.util.implementations
Provides implementations of AnimatedArchitecture core interfaces that can be used by all modules for the Spigot platform.
  • Classes in nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.commands used by nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.api
    Class
    Description
    CommandDefinition
    Represents the various commands that are used along with their user/admin permission nodes.
    CommandFactory
    Represents a factory for commands.
    ICommandSender
     
    IServer
    Represents the server as an ICommandSender
    PermissionsStatus
    Represents a pair of booleans that determine whether a user has user-level and/or admin-level permission access to some kind of action.
  • Classes in nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.commands used by nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.commands
    Class
    Description
    AddOwner
    Represents the command that adds co-owners to a given structure.
    AddOwnerDelayed
     
    AddOwnerDelayed.DelayedInput
    Represents the data that can be provided as delayed input for this command.
    BaseCommand
    Represents the base AnimatedArchitecture command.
    Cancel
    Represents the cancel command, which cancels any processes waiting for user input (e.g.
    CommandDefinition
    Represents the various commands that are used along with their user/admin permission nodes.
    CommandFactory
    Represents a factory for commands.
    Confirm
    Represents the confirm command, which is used to confirm actions AnimatedArchitecture is waiting on.
    Debug
    Represents the debug command.
    DelayedCommand
    Represents a delayed command.
    DelayedCommand.Context
     
    DelayedCommandInputRequest
    Represents a request for delayed additional input for a command.
    DelayedCommandInputRequest.IFactory
     
    Delete
    Represents the command that is used to delete structures.
    ICommandSender
     
    Info
    Represents the information command that provides the issuer with more information about the structure.
    InspectPowerBlock
    Represents the command to inspect a location to check if there are any powerblocks registered there.
    ListStructures
    Represents a command to list a number of structures matching a single StructureRetrieverFactory.
    Lock
    Represents the command that is used to change whether a structure is locked.
    Menu
    Represents the menu command, which is used to open the menu for a user.
    MovePowerBlock
    Represents the command to initiate the process to move the powerblock of a structure to a different location.
    NewStructure
    Represents the command that is used to create new structures.
    PermissionsStatus
    Represents a pair of booleans that determine whether a user has user-level and/or admin-level permission access to some kind of action.
    RemoveOwner
    Represents the remove owner command.
    RemoveOwnerDelayed
     
    Restart
    Represents the command that is used to restart AnimatedArchitecture.
    SetBlocksToMove
    Represents the command that is used to change the number of blocks a block will try to move.
    SetBlocksToMoveDelayed
     
    SetName
    Represents the setName command, which is used to provide a name for a ToolUser.
    SetOpenDirection
    Represents the command that changes the opening direction of structures.
    SetOpenDirectionDelayed
     
    SetOpenStatus
    Represents the command that changes the opening status of structures.
    SetOpenStatusDelayed
     
    Specify
    Implements the command to specify a structure for the StructureSpecificationManager.
    StopStructures
    Represents the command used to stop all active structures.
    StructureTargetCommand
    Represents a command that relates to an existing structure.
    StructureTargetCommand.StructureDescription
    A simple description of a structure.
    Toggle
    Represents a command that toggles a structure.
    UpdateCreator
    Represents a command that is used to update active Creator processes with arbitrary data in out-of-procedure order.
    Version
    Represents the command that shows the ICommandSender the current version of the plugin that is running.
